verses.verse: Behold,<WH2005> I will send<WH7971> my messenger,<WH4397> and he shall prepare<WH6437> the way<WH1870> before<WH6440> me: and the LORD,<WH113> whom<WH834> you seek,<WH1245> shall suddenly<WH6597> come<WH935> to his temple,<WH1964> even the messenger<WH4397> of the covenant,<WH1285> whom<WH834> you delight<WH2655> in: behold,<WH2009> he shall come,<WH935> said<WH559> the LORD<WH3068> of hosts.<WH6635>

But who<WH4310> may abide<WH3557> the day<WH3117> of his coming?<WH935> and who<WH4310> shall stand<WH5975> when he appears?<WH7200> for he is like a refiner's<WH6884> fire,<WH784> and like fullers'<WH3526> soap:<WH1287>

And he shall sit<WH3427> as a refiner<WH6884> and purifier<WH2891> of silver:<WH3701> and he shall purify<WH2891> the sons<WH1121> of Levi,<WH3878> and purge<WH2212> them as gold<WH2091> and silver,<WH3701> that they may offer<WH5066> to the LORD<WH3068> an offering<WH4503> in righteousness.<WH6666>
Then shall the offering<WH4503> of Judah<WH3063> and Jerusalem<WH3389> be pleasant<WH6149> to the LORD,<WH3068> as in the days<WH3117> of old,<WH5769> and as in former<WH6931> years.<WH8141>

And I will come<WH7126> near<WH7126> to you to judgment;<WH4941> and I will be a swift<WH4116> witness<WH5707> against the sorcerers,<WH3784> and against the adulterers,<WH5003> and against false<WH8267> swearers,<WH7650> and against those that oppress<WH6231> the hireling<WH7916> in his wages,<WH7939> the widow,<WH490> and the fatherless,<WH3490> and that turn<WH5186> aside<WH5186> the stranger<WH1616> from his right, and fear<WH3372> not me, said<WH559> the LORD<WH3068> of hosts.<WH6635>
For I am the LORD,<WH3068> I change<WH8138> not; therefore you sons<WH1121> of Jacob<WH3290> are not consumed.<WH3615>

Even from the days<WH3117> of your fathers<WH1> you are gone<WH5493> away<WH5493> from my ordinances,<WH2706> and have not kept<WH8104> them. Return<WH7725> to me, and I will return<WH7725> to you, said<WH559> the LORD<WH3068> of hosts.<WH6635> But you said,<WH559> Wherein<WH4100> shall we return?<WH7725>
Will a man<WH120> rob<WH6906> God?<WH430> Yet you have robbed<WH6906> me. But you say,<WH559> Wherein<WH4100> have we robbed<WH6906> you? In tithes<WH4643> and offerings.<WH8641>
You are cursed<WH779> with a curse:<WH3994> for you have robbed<WH6906> me, even this whole<WH3605> nation.<WH1471>

Bring<WH935> you all<WH3605> the tithes<WH4643> into<WH413> the storehouse,<WH214> that there may be meat<WH2964> in my house,<WH1004> and prove<WH974> me now<WH4994> herewith,<WH2063> said<WH559> the LORD<WH3068> of hosts,<WH6635> if I will not open<WH6605> you the windows<WH699> of heaven,<WH8064> and pour<WH7324> you out a blessing,<WH1293> that there shall not be room enough<WH1767> to receive it.

And I will rebuke<WH1605> the devourer<WH398> for your sakes, and he shall not destroy<WH7843> the fruits<WH6529> of your ground;<WH127> neither<WH3808> shall your vine<WH1612> cast<WH7921> her fruit<WH7921> before the time in the field,<WH7704> said<WH559> the LORD<WH3068> of hosts.<WH6635>
And all<WH3605> nations<WH1471> shall call<WH833> you blessed:<WH833> for you shall be a delightsome<WH2656> land,<WH776> said<WH559> the LORD<WH3068> of hosts.<WH6635>
Your words<WH1697> have been stout<WH2388> against<WH5921> me, said<WH559> the LORD.<WH3068> Yet you say,<WH559> What<WH4100> have we spoken<WH1696> so much against<WH5921> you?

You have said,<WH559> It is vain<WH7723> to serve<WH5647> God:<WH430> and what<WH4100> profit<WH1215> is it that we have kept<WH8104> his ordinance,<WH4931> and that we have walked<WH1980> mournfully<WH6941> before<WH6440> the LORD<WH3068> of hosts?<WH6635>

And now<WH6258> we call<WH833> the proud<WH2086> happy;<WH833> yes,<WH1571> they that work<WH6213> wickedness<WH7564> are set<WH1129> up; yes,<WH1571> they that tempt<WH974> God<WH430> are even delivered.<WH4422>

Then they that feared<WH3372> the LORD<WH3068> spoke<WH1696> often one<WH376> to another:<WH7453> and the LORD<WH3068> listened,<WH7181> and heard<WH8085> it, and a book<WH5612> of remembrance<WH2146> was written<WH3789> before<WH6440> him for them that feared<WH3372> the LORD,<WH3068> and that thought<WH2803> on his name.<WH8034>

And they shall be mine, said<WH559> the LORD<WH3068> of hosts,<WH6635> in that day<WH3117> when<WH834> I make<WH6213> up my jewels;<WH5459> and I will spare<WH2550> them, as a man<WH376> spares<WH2550> his own son<WH1121> that serves<WH5647> him.
Then shall you return,<WH7725> and discern<WH7200> between<WH996> the righteous<WH6662> and the wicked,<WH7563> between<WH996> him that serves<WH5647> God<WH430> and him that serves<WH5647> him not.
